newsitem.title: FRANCE: EU TO SUPPLY 10,000 TONNES OF RICE TO NORTH KOREA.
newsitem.headline: EU TO SUPPLY 10,000 TONNES OF RICE TO NORTH KOREA.

text.p: The European Union has organised a shipment of 10,000 tonnes of rice to North Korea as famine relief, officials said on Wednesday.
A tender to buy a further 20,000 tonnes of rice from the market for delivery to North Korea could be launched later, they said, but no details were available.
The first shipment will be delivered by October as part of a relief effort organised by the U.N. World Food Programme, officials said.
The rice was bought in a tender on the WFP's behalf by the European Commission but details of the purchase have not been released.
Separately the Commission has tendered for 24,000 tonnes of maize for North Korea, and grain traders said results of this purchase were expected on Wednesday.
Aid agencies have stepped up calls for food aid to stave off hunger in North Korea, where they warn famine is imminent, especially among young children.
U.N. food experts say 70 percent of maize crops were ruined by North Korea's worst drought in over half a century this year, compounding already grave shortages.
